content.question: ​A data set of coordinate pairs is modeled by the function <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals sin theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. If the model <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is consistent with the data set, which of the following should describe the dependent variable values on the interval <math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​The values should be decreasing at a decreasing rate on the interval.
​​The values should be decreasing at an increasing rate on the interval.
​The values should be increasing at a decreasing rate on the interval.​
​​The values should be increasing at an increasing rate on the interval.

content.answer: ​​The values should be decreasing at an increasing rate on the interval.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
